q: No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed.
h:
“No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: When angry count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
h:
“When angry count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Know your gifts and share them.
h:
“Know your gifts and share them.” —
Les Brown

q: Conscience is a dog that does not stop us from passing but that we cannot prevent from barking.
h:
“Conscience is a dog that does not stop us from passing but that we cannot prevent from barking.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: Life can be the scariest and most beautiful thing simultaneously.
h:
“Life can be the scariest and most beautiful thing simultaneously.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
h:
“Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack. ” —
Seneca

q: The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.
h:
“The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control.
h:
“A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.
h:
“Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.” —
Unknown

q: Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.
h:
“Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Common sense is not so common.
h:
“Common sense is not so common. ” —
Voltaire

q: As you grow older you will discover that you have two hands. One for helping yourself, the other for helping others.
h:
“As you grow older you will discover that you have two hands. One for helping yourself, the other for helping others.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.
h:
“Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Spend eighty percent of your time focusing on the opportunities of tomorrow rather than the problems of yesterday.
h:
“Spend eighty percent of your time focusing on the opportunities of tomorrow rather than the problems of yesterday.” —
Brian Tracy

q: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
h:
“To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.
h:
“The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.” —
James Allen

q: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
h:
“A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
h:
“Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.” —
Voltaire

q: Every drop in the ocean counts.
h:
“Every drop in the ocean counts. ” —
Yoko Ono

q: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
h:
“Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them. ” —
Seneca

q: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
h:
“Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.” —
Og Mandino

q: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
h:
“Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
h:
“The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: This is such a short and precious life that it's really important that you don't spend it being unhappy.
h:
“This is such a short and precious life that it's really important that you don't spend it being unhappy.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.
h:
“Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.
h:
“Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.” —
Bob Marley

q: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
h:
“A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
h:
“Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.” —
Buddha

q: Better to die fighting for freedom than be a prisoner all the days of your life.
h:
“Better to die fighting for freedom than be a prisoner all the days of your life.” —
Bob Marley

q: Don't learn to do, but learn in doing.
h:
“Don't learn to do, but learn in doing.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
h:
“Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.” —
Colin Powell

q: Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.
h:
“Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.” —
Bob Marley

q: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
h:
“A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.” —
Charles Dickens

q: As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.
h:
“As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.” —
James Allen

q: Life and death are of supreme importance. Time swiftly passes by and opportunity is lost.
h:
“Life and death are of supreme importance. Time swiftly passes by and opportunity is lost.” —
Dogen

q: The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for.
h:
“The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for.” —
Bob Marley

q: Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile.
h:
“Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile.” —
Og Mandino

q: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing. The worst thing you can do is nothing.
h:
“In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing. The worst thing you can do is nothing.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Start the day with love, spend the day with love, fill the day with love and end the day with love.
h:
“Start the day with love, spend the day with love, fill the day with love and end the day with love.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.
h:
“Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.” —
Tony Robbins

q: We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.
h:
“We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.” —
William Faulkner

q: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
h:
“All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
h:
“Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them. ” —
Seneca

q: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
h:
“To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: To forget the whole world is easy; to make the whole world forget you is hard.
h:
“To forget the whole world is easy; to make the whole world forget you is hard.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
h:
“Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it.
h:
“The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Each problem has a positive side.
h:
“Each problem has a positive side.” —
Og Mandino

q: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
h:
“The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.” —
Helen Keller

q: Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.
h:
“Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.” —
Leonardo da Vinci
